author: Ryan

text: I wouldn't call orchlight a Diablo clone. It's made by the co-founders of Blizzard (who left Blizzard to start Runic Games) and the composer of Diablo I and Diablo II (Matt Uemlen). I'd say Diablo 3 is the clone XD
author: Matias L

text: Got anymore Diablo clones?
author: playtoyx

text: @xChrisBoulterx I gave it a fair chance, i was unbiased and actually hoped that it would satisfy my craving for another Diablo type game but it didnt. The gameplay is ok, the graphics are far superior to D2 but there was just something about it i didnt like. It didnt feel like it was made by the same creators but more like a ripoff. I think the thing i disliked the most is that you cant play it online

author: orlandothx

text:
@Zamolxx Vanquisher Lv 33, other two between 10 and 15. Count the days. ;)
Before criticizing openly, I try to play for at least 5 full hours.
Buggy = opponent hit-boxes are too small. Monster cover almost 1/4 of screen and I have to click on his legs (which are smaller then my character's legs), and quests are more monotone than Freelancer.
When it comes to other clones, I've played lots of other H&S games (at least 10 different), and this one just screams: "I'm a cheap Diablo and WOW clone".
author: Dominik Lelek

text:
@Zamolxx Can't agree.
Tried playing it and noticed that controls are quite... "buggy" so to say.
And only difference between classes is Lv which you need to be for some skills.

Cheap ripoff in every sense of the word...
